Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(2) Summary

Most software developed today exposes an API. It's important to manage the full lifecycle of these APIs so that they can be consumed safely and robustly. A second important aspect is how developers can used their own APIs and their descriptions to drive their development process. For this, we'll take a look at API descriptions in general and at OpenAPI in particular. We then look at how lifecycle management both for consumers and producers can be supported by using API descriptions and associated tooling. Finally, we'll discuss how this is a logical pathway for establishing and evolving your platform engineering practice.



Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(7) API All The Things!

  • Every organization today is (partly) a software organization
  • Being able to build a system isn't good enough anymore
  • Designing, growing, and evolving an ecosystem is equally important
  • Jeff Bezos' API Mandate [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hIP7mHRog4o] is picking up steam after 20 years


API Products Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(8) API Landscape



API Products Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(9) Scaling the API Practice

  • With great growth come great economies of scale
  • Designing more APIs → A slightly coherent look&feel makes sense
  • Developing more APIs → Removing busy work pays off
  • Deploying more APIs → Automation helps with time to production
  • Consuming more APIs → Keeping track of the landscapes gets trickier


API Products Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(12) API Descriptions as Digital Building Block Lingua Franca

  • Shared understanding of the shape of digital building blocks
  • Team-to-team communications to increase rate of flow
  • B2B communications to market and explain products
  • Cross-functional language to work on digital products
  • Descriptions are useful for improved API literacy


API Products Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

  1. Choosing description language and version
  2. Defining API product and its versioning policy
  3. Describing ASPI product and versioning descriptions
  4. Ignoring implementation version

API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(16) A Brief History of OpenAPI & OAI

  • Started out in 2011 and was called Swagger [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swagger_(software)] for quite a while
    • Competing approaches like RAML [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RAML_(software)] and API Blueprint [https://github.com/apiaryio/api-blueprint] exist
  • Swagger was renamed to OpenAPI at the beginning of 2016
    • Donated to the OpenAPI Initiative (OAI) [https://www.openapis.org/] (part of the Linux Foundation [https://www.linuxfoundation.org/])
    • Swagger [https://swagger.io/tools/open-source/] now refers to a specific tool offered by SmartBear [https://smartbear.com/]
  • OpenAPI has been the official name since 2016
    • OpenAPI 2.0 was the name after the rename (it's the same as Swagger 2.0)
    • OpenAPI 3.0 was released in July 2017
    • OpenAPI 3.1 was released in February 2021
    • OpenAPI 4.0 (Moonwalk) [https://github.com/OAI/moonwalk] is under discussion


API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(17) OpenAPI in 60 Seconds

  • Interactions
    • Web: Pages that you need to get your job done
    • API: URIs that you can access by sending HTTP requests
  • Parameters
    • Web: Forms you fill out when a step needs additional input
    • API: Some interactions require additional information (POST/PUT)
  • Representations
    • Web: Your browsers renders (most) responses that it gets
    • API: Responses can be described by media types or schemas


API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(18) Discovery and Getting Started 

paths:
  /pet:
    put:
      tags:
      - pet
      summary: Update an existing pet
      description: Update an existing pet by Id
      operationId: updatePet
      requestBody:
        description: Update an existent pet in the store
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/Pet'
  • petstore-openapi.yaml (line 37-50)
      responses:
        "200":
          description: Successful operation
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/Pet'
  • petstore-openapi.yaml (line 58-64)


API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(19) WIIFM: Everybody's Favorite Station



API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(20) WIIFM: Business and Organization Value

As business or organization leader
I want well-defined and usable digital interfaces for partners and the public
so that I can more easily change and scale my value streams.


API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(21) WIIFM: API Developers

As an API developer
I want to describe the product I am going to implement
so that I can use various tools throughout the API lifecycle.


API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(22) WIIFM: API Consumers

As an API consumer
I want APIs to have standardized descriptions
so that I can easily understand and consume the products I am accessing.


API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(23) WIIFM: Platform People

As an API platform person
I want to support standardized description formats
so that all producers and consumers speak in the same language.


API Descriptions and OpenAPI Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(27) The API Monetization Myth

  • Don't think about a business model for your API
  • Do think about new opportunities for your business
  • Do think about an API for your business model


Building the Right API Erik Wilde, INNOQ: Building Software Better: API Lifecycle Management for Developers

(33) Most API Value Creation is Indirect

  1. Using APIs to become better at reuse and innovation
  2. Reducing friction by having teams communicate via APIs
  3. Using API First as a way to build everything as digital building blocks

(46) Strategy Beats Tactics

  1. Think of components as (API) products
  2. Build the right (API) products
  3. Build (API) products the right way
  4. Scale your (API) practices with a platform
